title: The 3,700pc hike in death fees is a farce and must be scrapped before an election
text:
Rejoice! Party conference season is finally over. Our MPs can stop making lofty promises to the beleaguered citizens of regional towns – and make them in London instead.

As my colleague Lauren Davidson wrote yesterday, the Chancellor, Sajid Javid, dangled the carrot of reforming inheritance tax as his pre-election party piece.

What he should have done is announce a sharp about-turn on huge planned increases to probate fees. Whatever you think about IHT, there is at least some logic to the system. The same cannot be said of the Government’s 3,700pc increase in the cost of obtaining a “grant of probate”, needed to distribute an estate.

Currently, an executor will pay a flat fee of £215, or £155...
